intro: Nigritella ravnikii, commonly known as the Malabar nightshade, is a flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and potatoes. The plant is characterized by its small, dark purple berries that mature in the autumn. It typically grows in moist, shaded forest environments and has hairy, ovate leaves. Due to its toxic properties, it is not suitable for cultivation or consumption.
